ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Normal peripheral hearing with significant bilateral deficits in temporal ordering, dichotic listening, compressed speech, and speech-in-noise tasks.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Learning Disability (Alexia/Agraphia)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Inability to read or write cursive and slow reading rate, likely linked to the same cortical dysfunction in association areas as the auditory deficits.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Baseline assessment of peripheral hearing sensitivity.
Assess speech recognition abilities in quiet.
Evaluate central auditory function given complaints of difficulty in noise and following lectures.
Assess speech recognition in ipsilateral white noise due to specific complaints of difficulty in noise.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing sensitivity is normal, but speech recognition is unexpectedly reduced in quiet and severely depressed in noise. The central battery reveals bilateral deficits across all tests, with moderate-to-severe impairment in temporal ordering and compressed speech, consistent with a severe central auditory deficit likely involving cortical association regions.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Reduced word recognition scores in quiet (68-72% bilaterally).

tests.name: Central Auditory Processing Battery
tests.result_summary: Bilateral deficits on all tests: moderate-to-severe on frequency/duration patterns (~40-60%), mild on SSW (~70-80%), severe on compressed speech (RE ~0%, LE ~27%) and dichotic rhyme (~20-30%). Dichotic digits showed borderline/mild deficits (RE ~90%, LE ~85%).

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Severely depressed scores in ipsilateral white noise at +10 dB SNR (RE 16%, LE 8%).

proposed_items: Preferential seating to maximize visual cues and minimize noise
Academic accommodations (e.g., untimed tests, small class sizes)
counseling_actions: Explain that difficulties in noise and on the phone are due to a central deficit, not peripheral hearing loss
Discuss the neurological link between the auditory processing deficits and reading/writing difficulties (alexia/agraphia)
Encourage self-advocacy with administrative personnel to obtain necessary accommodations

escalation.rationale_short: To secure academic accommodations such as untimed testing for medical school entrance exams.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor academic progress and the effectiveness of accommodations.

expected_outcome: The patient successfully completed her baccalaureate degree.
The patient was on several waiting lists for admission to medical school at the time of last contact.
